qas.question: What modern movement began in the 20th century?
What were the roots of the modern Pentecostal movement?
In what city did the modern Pentecostal movement begin?
What type of mission was the birthplace of the modern Pentecostal movement?

context: A noteworthy development in 20th-century Protestant Christianity was the rise of <a0_0>the modern Pentecostal movement<a0_0/>. Sprung from <a1_0>Methodist and Wesleyan<a1_0/> roots, it arose out of meetings at an <a4_0>urban<a4_0/> mission on Azusa Street in <a3_0>Los Angeles<a3_0/>. From there it spread around the world, carried by those who experienced what they believed to be miraculous moves of God there. These Pentecost-like manifestations have steadily been in evidence throughout the history, such as seen in the two Great Awakenings. Pentecostalism, which in turn birthed <a2_0>the Charismatic movement<a2_0/> within already established denominations, continues to be an important force in Western Christianity.
